topic.title: web browser for p2p decentralized sites
topic.body:
https://github.com/AgregoreWeb/agregore-browser

once bep 46 is added to webtorrent, then i think p2p sites will be viable, basically having sites on bittorrent

1616209212_1M1U9ZvF9XJmt4oPY4TLBWHJZWDdR.body:
there are other networks
hyperdrive, ipfs, bittorrent

also a cool browser called agregore browser

bittorrent has bep 46 for mutable torrents which would help publishing updated content on bittorrent network

ipfs is great for static content

hyperdrive is good for streaming

use tor and then just need a browser to put it all together

1628848642_15Ef8fbH5j5WZuMNoKum5u6WYFguX.body:
ipfs for static content
hyperdrive/hypercore for streaming content
bittorrent/webtorrent for files
gundb for p2p database

either need browser support or a new browser

1629908963_1NRVBTxrbgEFdVBNLczx4Cc6NV3H4.body: a new religion should take over south asia and india. south asia should also disintegrate and multiple small nation states should be made for better representation

1629867851_18sXfWjdTFrNQW8wAV1bdwJ5evxCZ.body: americans are destroyers of usa, also the usa spreads aids around the world

1631520906_14WBfL5EWU5X3a7dcTwMvtDrcWYFA.body:
> [transcoder](#comment_34_15q24B3R72uWT1UwtRMdFDmm3VXKcKVSiH): i have tried it before, the webbrowser is definetely very minimal however. maybe something like galacteek may work in the future howevever

i like the minimal aspect of this. i read about galacteek before but it uses ipfs only. i don't think any single alternative protocol/system will take off, they are too specialized. ipfs sucks for streaming and mutable data. they have ipns but they will still have problem. hypercore is much better for streaming. a browser that mixes these specialized protocols would be the best to deliver ane xperienc ethat everyone is already used to.

> [kaffie](#comment_1196_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): I don't really see the point tbh. It looks like it just merges dat and ipfs, and forces you to use a shitty web browser.

the average common person out there is not using command line or or making a single line of code. they want a browser to make everything easy so they can look at websites. this is what it does. projects like these are what is needed for average people to interact with the p2p web.
